metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11360 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow in iptables-restore in netfilter iptables 1.8.2 allows an attacker to (at least) crash the program or potentially gain code execution via a specially crafted iptables-save file. This is related to add_param_to_argv in xshared.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11360` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

iptables - 1.8.3-2ubuntu4
libip4tc2 - 1.8.3-2ubuntu4
libip6tc2 - 1.8.3-2ubuntu4
libiptc0 - 1.8.3-2ubuntu4
libxtables12 - 1.8.3-2ubuntu4
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> To exploit this, you would need to trick someone into restoring a set of iptables rules from a malicious iptables-save file. This is quite an unlikely scenario. Reproducer doesn't work on xenial and bionic, like an issue in 1.8.2 only.

criterions.comment: iptables package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.3-2ubuntu4').
